name: Kaalia of the Vast
text:
Flying
Whenever Kaalia of the Vast attacks an opponent, you may put an Angel, Demon, or Dragon creature card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped and attacking that opponent.

editions.flavor: "I'll have my revenge if I have to call on every force from above and below."
"I'll have my revenge if I have to call on every force from above and below."

name: Kabira Crossroads
text:
Kabira Crossroads enters the battlefield tapped.
When Kabira Crossroads enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

name: Kabira Evangel
text: Whenever Kabira Evangel or another Ally enters the battlefield under your control, you may choose a color. If you do, Allies you control gain protection from the chosen color until end of turn.

name: Kabira Vindicator
text:
Level up {2}{W} ({2}{W}: Put a level counter on this. Level up only as a sorcery.)
LEVEL 2-4
3/6
Other creatures you control get +1/+1.
LEVEL 5+
4/8
Other creatures you control get +2/+2.

name: Kaboom!
text: Choose any number of target players. For each of those players, reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a nonland card. Kaboom! deals damage equal to that card's converted mana cost to that player, then you put the revealed cards on the bottom of your library in any order.

name: Kabuto Moth
text:
Flying
{T}: Target creature gets +1/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Many great warriors died in the first days of the war, as the spirits of their weaponry turned against them with terrifying rage."
—Observations of the Kami War

name: Kaervek's Hex
text: Kaervek's Hex deals 1 damage to each nonblack creature and an additional 1 damage to each green creature.

editions.flavor:
"If the curse does not strike you dead, question your soul."
—Kaervek

name: Kaervek's Purge
text: Destroy target creature with converted mana cost X. If that creature dies this way, Kaervek's Purge deals damage equal to the creature's power to the creature's controller.

name: Kaervek's Spite
text:
As an additional cost to cast Kaervek's Spite, sacrifice all permanents you control and discard your hand.
Target player loses 5 life.

editions.flavor:
"The end justifies the means. What do I care if I rule over the dead rather than over the living? The dead ask fewer questions."
—Kaervek

name: Kaervek's Torch
text:
As long as Kaervek's Torch is on the stack, spells that target it cost {2} more to cast.
Kaervek's Torch deals X damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor:
The pulsing heat of the midday Sun burns in the Lion's eye.
—Stone inscription, source unknown

The pulsing heat of the midday Sun burns in the Lion's eye.
—Stone inscription, source unknown

name: Kaervek the Merciless
text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, Kaervek the Merciless deals damage to target creature or player equal to that spell's converted mana cost.

editions.flavor:
"Rats and jackals feast in his swath, but even they will not walk with him."
—Mangara

"Rats and jackals feast in his swath, but even they will not walk with him."
—Mangara

name: Kagemaro, First to Suffer
text:
Kagemaro, First to Suffer's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
{B}, Sacrifice Kagemaro: All creatures get -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards in your hand.

name: Kagemaro's Clutch
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -X/-X, where X is the number of cards in your hand.

editions.flavor: The mist was thick, cloying, and constricting. Shiro fought his way to fresh air only to look back and see his comrades fallen on the battlefield behind him.

name: Kaho, Minamo Historian
text:
When Kaho, Minamo Historian enters the battlefield, search your library for up to three instant cards and exile them. Then shuffle your library.
{X}, {T}: You may cast a card with converted mana cost X exiled with Kaho without paying its mana cost.

name: Kaijin of the Vanishing Touch
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Kaijin of the Vanishing Touch blocks a creature, return that creature to its owner's hand at end of combat. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)

editions.flavor: When it's finished, all that's left of you is a ripple on a still pond.

name: Kaiso, Memory of Loyalty
text:
Flying
Remove a ki counter from Kaiso, Memory of Loyalty: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.

name: Kalastria Healer
text: Rally — Whenever Kalastria Healer or another Ally enters the battlefield under your control, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: "Time and again, I have demonstrated my skills as a healer. Why, then, are you so ill at ease?"

name: Kalastria Highborn
text: Whenever Kalastria Highborn or another Vampire you control dies, you may pay {B}. If you do, target player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: Each of Malakir's great families boasts a contingent of nulls appropriate to its rank in society.

name: Kalastria Nightwatch
text: Whenever you gain life, Kalastria Nightwatch gains flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Kalitas may have returned to mindless servitude beneath the Eldrazi, but we say never again."—Drana, Kalastria bloodchief

name: Kaleidostone
text:
When Kaleidostone enters the battlefield, draw a card.
{5}, {T}, Sacrifice Kaleidostone: Add {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Once broken, who knows what worlds might grow from its shards?

name: Kalemne, Disciple of Iroas
text:
Double strike, vigilance
Whenever you cast a creature spell with converted mana cost 5 or greater, you get an experience counter.
Kalemne, Disciple of Iroas gets +1/+1 for each experience counter you have.

name: Kalemne's Captain
text:
Vigilance
{5}{W}{W}: Monstrosity 3. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put three +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)
When Kalemne's Captain becomes monstrous, exile all artifacts and enchantments.

name: Kalitas, Bloodchief of Ghet
text: {B}{B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target creature. If that creature dies this way, create a black Vampire creature token. Its power is equal to that creature's power and its toughness is equal to that creature's toughness.

name: Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet
text:
Lifelink
If a nontoken creature an opponent controls would die, instead exile that card and create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
{2}{B}, Sacrifice another Vampire or Zombie: Put two +1/+1 counters on Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet.

name: Kalonian Behemoth
text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

editions.flavor:
"Do not fire upon it—it is bad luck. And a waste of arrows."
—Alera Benath, Kalonian ranger

name: Kalonian Hydra
text:
Trample
Kalonian Hydra enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever Kalonian Hydra attacks, double the number of +1/+1 counters on each creature you control.

editions.flavor: Even baloths fear its feeding time.
Even baloths fear its feeding time.

"And all this time I thought we were tracking it."
—Juruk, Kalonian tracker

name: Kalonian Twingrove
text:
Kalonian Twingrove's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control.
When Kalonian Twingrove enters the battlefield, create a green Treefolk Warrior creature token with "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control."

name: Kamahl, Fist of Krosa
text:
{G}: Target land becomes a 1/1 creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
{2}{G}{G}{G}: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "My mind has changed. My strength has not."
"My mind has changed. My strength has not."

name: Kamahl, Pit Fighter
text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
{T}: Kamahl, Pit Fighter deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: "I didn't come to play. I came to win."
In times when freedom seems lost, great souls arise to reclaim it.
In times when freedom seems lost, great souls arise to reclaim it.
In times when freedom seems lost, great souls arise to reclaim it.
In times when freedom seems lost, great souls arise to reclaim it.

name: Kamahl's Desire
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has first strike.
Threshold — Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

name: Kamahl's Sledge
text:
Kamahl's Sledge deals 4 damage to target creature.
Threshold — If seven or more cards are in your graveyard, instead Kamahl's Sledge deals 4 damage to that creature and 4 damage to that creature's controller.

name: Kamahl's Summons
text: Each player may reveal any number of creature cards from his or her hand. Then each player creates a 2/2 green Bear creature token for each card he or she revealed this way.

editions.flavor: As Krosa unleashed the peace in Kamahl, he unleashed the fury in Krosa.

name: Kambal, Consul of Allocation
text: Whenever an opponent casts a noncreature spell, that player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: He has "friends" in places both high and low, and all seem to owe him favors.

name: Kami of Ancient Law
text: Sacrifice Kami of Ancient Law: Destroy target enchantment.

editions.flavor:
"Duty and law are the foundation on which civilization stands. They must not fall, for when they do, they take everything with them."
—Lord Konda

"Duty and law are the foundation on which civilization stands. They must not fall, for when they do, they take everything with them."
—Lord Konda

name: Kami of Empty Graves
text: Soulshift 3 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

name: Kami of False Hope
text: Sacrifice Kami of False Hope: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

editions.flavor:
"Across the rift of battle, a bridge of gossamer. And for one moment, it holds."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

name: Kami of Fire's Roar
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, target creature can't block this turn.

editions.flavor:
"I can hear the shamans chanting in the hills. They say their magic will protect us from the kami, that our gold has bought our safety. But no one sleeps soundly tonight."
—Scroll fragment from the ruins of Reito

name: Kami of Lunacy
text:
Flying
Soulshift 5 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 5 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

editions.flavor:
"There was a wall here. Now it is dust. A tower rose here. Now it is fallen. An army fought here. Now it is dead. A spirit was here. It is all that remains."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

"There was a wall here. Now it is dust. A tower rose here. Now it is fallen. An army fought here. Now it is dead. A spirit was here. It is all that remains."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

name: Kami of Tattered Shoji
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, Kami of Tattered Shoji gains flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor: It remembered all the shadows lantern-cast upon its paper wings, and sometimes those silhouettes played across its shape again, acting out silent tragedies.

name: Kami of the Crescent Moon
text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player draws an additional card.

editions.flavor:
"He's a lot like me, that masterless little kami . . . unimpressed by grandeur and never at a loss for a trick."
—Toshiro Umezawa

"He's a lot like me, that masterless little kami . . . unimpressed by grandeur and never at a loss for a trick."
—Toshiro Umezawa

name: Kami of the Honored Dead
text:
Flying
Whenever Kami of the Honored Dead is dealt damage, you gain that much life.
Soulshift 6 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 6 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

name: Kami of the Hunt
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, Kami of the Hunt gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Don't worry, Jiro. The kami would never attack us this close to home . . . . Jiro?"
—Hoto, temple guardian, last words

name: Kami of the Painted Road
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, Kami of the Painted Road gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

editions.flavor: In ancient times, precepts of kami law were inscribed onto bridges as a gesture of respect. During the war, humans regarded them as warnings of where not to travel.

name: Kami of the Palace Fields
text:
Flying, first strike
Soulshift 5 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 5 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

name: Kami of the Tended Garden
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Kami of the Tended Garden unless you pay {G}.
Soulshift 3 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

name: Kami of the Waning Moon
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, target creature gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

editions.flavor:
"For a moment, Reito's defenders regrouped. Then wailing kami reappeared to send them scattering like flocks of frightened birds."
—Great Battles of Kamigawa

name: Kami of Twisted Reflection
text: Sacrifice Kami of Twisted Reflection: Return target creature you control to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Its form reflected humanity as it stood during the Kami War: disjointed, confused, and incomplete.

name: Kangee, Aerie Keeper
text:
Kicker {X}{2} (You may pay an additional {X}{2} as you cast this spell.)
Flying
When Kangee, Aerie Keeper enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, put X feather counters on it.
Other Bird creatures get +1/+1 for each feather counter on Kangee, Aerie Keeper.

name: Kapsho Kitefins
text:
Flying
Whenever Kapsho Kitefins or another creature enters the battlefield under your control, tap target creature an opponent controls.

editions.flavor:
"It's a truly disconcerting sight to see their shadows cast upon the deck."
—Captain Triff

name: Karador, Ghost Chieftain
text:
Karador, Ghost Chieftain costs {1} less to cast for each creature card in your graveyard.
During each of your turns, you may cast one creature card from your graveyard.

editions.flavor: "Death tried to uncrown me. But now I return, king of a greater realm."
"Death tried to uncrown me. But now I return, king of a greater realm."

name: Karakas
text:
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
{T}: Return target legendary creature to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"To make a prairie it takes a clover and one bee,/ One clover, and a bee,/ And revery."
—Emily Dickinson
"To make a prairie it takes a clover and one bee,/ One clover, and a bee,/ And revery." —Emily Dickinson

name: Karametra, God of Harvests
text:
Indestructible
As long as your devotion to green and white is less than seven, Karametra isn't a creature.
Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may search your library for a Forest or Plains card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

name: Karametra's Acolyte
text: {T}: Add an amount of {G} to your mana pool equal to your devotion to green. (Each {G} in the mana costs of permanents you control counts toward your devotion to green.)

editions.flavor: "The wilds are a garden tended by divine hands."
"The wilds are a garden tended by divine hands."

name: Karametra's Favor
text:
Enchant creature
When Karametra's Favor enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

editions.flavor: The harvest god's cornucopia contains the fruits of the fields, the forest, and beyond.

name: Kargan Dragonlord
text:
Level up {R} ({R}: Put a level counter on this. Level up only as a sorcery.)
LEVEL 4-7
4/4
Flying
LEVEL 8+
8/8

{R}: Kargan Dragonlord gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

name: Kari Zev's Expertise
text:
Gain control of target creature or Vehicle until end of turn. Untap it. It gains haste until end of turn.
You may cast a card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your hand without paying its mana cost.

editions.flavor: "I was made for this!"

name: Kari Zev, Skyship Raider
text:
First strike, menace
Whenever Kari Zev, Skyship Raider attacks, create a legendary 2/1 red Monkey creature token named Ragavan that's tapped and attacking. Exile that token at end of combat.

editions.flavor: Aboard her ship, the Dragon's Smile, Kari follows no one's rules but her own.

name: Karlov of the Ghost Council
text:
Whenever you gain life, put two +1/+1 counters on Karlov of the Ghost Council.
{W}{B}, Remove six +1/+1 counters from Karlov of the Ghost Council: Exile target creature.

editions.flavor: "Does Teysa think me blind to her scheming? Ambition runs in our family."

name: Karma
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Karma deals damage to that player equal to the number of Swamps he or she controls.

name: Karmic Guide
text:
Flying, protection from black
Echo {3}{W}{W} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Karmic Guide enters the battlefield, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

name: Karmic Justice
text: Whenever a spell or ability an opponent controls destroys a noncreature permanent you control, you may destroy target permanent that opponent controls.

name: Karn
text: Each noncreature artifact you control is an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.

editions.flavor: Both part of the Legacy and an individual in his own right, the silver golem Karn is haunted by a single, terrible incident: while serving to protect the young Gerrard, Karn accidentally took the life of another. Wakened from years spent as a statue, the golem has vowed to never kill again as he rejoins Gerrard.

name: Karn Liberated
text:
+4: Target player exiles a card from his or her hand.
−3: Exile target permanent.
−14: Restart the game, leaving in exile all non-Aura permanent cards exiled with Karn Liberated. Then put those cards onto the battlefield under your control.

name: Karn, Silver Golem
text:
Whenever Karn, Silver Golem blocks or becomes blocked, it gets -4/+4 until end of turn.
{1}: Target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost until end of turn.

name: Karn's Touch
text: Target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost until end of turn. (It retains its abilities.)

name: Karona, False God
text:
Haste
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player untaps Karona, False God and gains control of it.
Whenever Karona attacks, creatures of the creature type of your choice get +3/+3 until end of turn.

name: Karona, False God Avatar
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, exchange control of a permanent you control chosen at random and a permanent target opponent controls chosen at random.

editions.flavor: SCG Participation Avatar

name: Karona's Zealot
text:
Morph {3}{W}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Karona's Zealot is turned face up, all damage that would be dealt to it this turn is dealt to target creature instead.

name: Karoo
text:
Karoo enters the battlefield tapped.
When Karoo enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Plains you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {C}{W} to your mana pool.

name: Karoo Meerkat
text: Protection from blue

editions.flavor:
"Be like the meerkat, my daughters: ever vigilant, true to your own, and wary of strangers."
—Nabil Alamat, Suq'Ata merchant

name: Karplusan Forest
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool. Karplusan Forest deals 1 damage to you.

name: Karplusan Giant
text: Tap an untapped snow land you control: Karplusan Giant gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"They aren't the brightest or the quickest of giants. For that matter, the same holds true if you compare them to rocks."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

"They aren't the brightest or the quickest of Giants. For that matter, the same holds true if you compare them to rocks."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Karplusan Minotaur
text:
Cumulative upkeep—Flip a coin. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Whenever you win a coin flip, Karplusan Minotaur deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Whenever you lose a coin flip, Karplusan Minotaur deals 1 damage to target creature or player of an opponent's choice.

name: Karplusan Strider
text: Karplusan Strider can't be the target of blue or black spells.

editions.flavor: The strider's long, loping gait is an adaptation that allows it to move quickly in deep snow.
The strider's long, loping gait is an adaptation that allows it to move quickly in deep snow.
The strider's long, loping gait is an adaptation that allows it to move quickly in deep snow.

name: Karplusan Wolverine
text: Whenever Karplusan Wolverine becomes blocked, you may have it deal 1 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor:
"They're not easily trained. Fortunately, they already know how to kill."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

name: Karplusan Yeti
text: {T}: Karplusan Yeti deals damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to Karplusan Yeti.

editions.flavor:
"What's that smell?"
—Perena Deepcutter,
Dwarven Armorer

name: Karrthus, Tyrant of Jund
text:
Flying, haste
When Karrthus, Tyrant of Jund enters the battlefield, gain control of all Dragons, then untap all Dragons.
Other Dragon creatures you control have haste.

name: Karstoderm
text:
Karstoderm enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield, remove a +1/+1 counter from Karstoderm.

name: Kaseto, Orochi Archmage
text: {G}{U}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn. If that creature is a Snake, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Our revered ancestor Seshiro gave us wisdom greater than poison and fangs."

name: Kashi-Tribe Elite
text:
Legendary Snakes you control have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
Whenever Kashi-Tribe Elite deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

name: Kashi-Tribe Reaver
text:
Whenever Kashi-Tribe Reaver deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
{1}{G}: Regenerate Kashi-Tribe Reaver.

name: Kashi-Tribe Warriors
text: Whenever Kashi-Tribe Warriors deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

editions.flavor: The orochi and the monks had always had an unspoken agreement: live and let live. But when the kami began raging, some warrior youths began questioning that agreement.
Popular indeed is the tale of how Kasimir was once a Holy man who renounced his order to take up the sword. But this tale is no more likely than any other.

name: Katabatic Winds
text:
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
Creatures with flying can't attack or block, and their activated abilities with {T} in their costs can't be activated.

editions.flavor: Wind will win, whatever we wish.

name: Kataki, War's Wage
text: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {1}."

editions.flavor:
"Before the war, we prayed to Kataki to sharpen our swords and harden our armor. Without his blessing our weapons are all but useless against the kami hordes."
—Kenzo the Hardhearted

"Before the war, we prayed to Kataki to sharpen our swords and harden our armor. Without his blessing our weapons are all but useless against the kami hordes."
—Kenzo the Hardhearted

—Kenzo the Hardhearted

text:
Flying
When Kathari Bomber deals combat damage to a player, create two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens and sacrifice Kathari Bomber.
Unearth {3}{B}{R} ({3}{B}{R}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

text:
Flying
{B}: Regenerate Kathari Remnant.
Cascade (When you cast this spell, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card that costs less. You may cast it without paying its mana cost. Put the exiled cards on the bottom of your library in a random order.)

name: Kathari Screecher
text:
Flying
Unearth {2}{U} ({2}{U}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

name: Kavu Aggressor
text:
Kicker {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell.)
Kavu Aggressor can't block.
If Kavu Aggressor was kicked, it enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.

name: Kavu Chameleon
text:
Kavu Chameleon can't be countered.
{G}: Kavu Chameleon becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"They weren't part of my plan, but Gaea insisted."
—Urza

name: Kavu Climber
text: When Kavu Climber enters the battlefield, draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"There was a crack of branches, a rustle of leaves, then a tremendous roar. Our party had no chance as death descended from above."
—Taseen, elvish bard
The appearance of the first kavu surprised Multani. As they continued to emerge, he no longer had any doubts about Yavimaya's ability to defend herself.

"There was a crack of branches, a rustle of leaves, then a tremendous roar. Our party had no chance as death descended from above."
—Taseen, elvish bard

name: Kavu Glider
text:
{W}: Kavu Glider gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
{U}: Kavu Glider gains flying until end of turn.

name: Kavu Howler
text: When Kavu Howler enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all Kavu cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

name: Kavu Lair
text: Whenever a creature with power 4 or greater enters the battlefield, its controller draws a card.

editions.flavor: As a dark rain of Phyrexians fell from the sky, fountains of kavu erupted from the ground.

name: Kavu Mauler
text:
Trample
Whenever Kavu Mauler attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each other attacking Kavu.

editions.flavor: To the kavu, all Phyrexians are merely crunchy snacks.

name: Kavu Monarch
text:
Kavu creatures have trample.
Whenever another Kavu enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on Kavu Monarch.

editions.flavor: Kavu emerged all across Dominaria, but the first and the strongest came from Yavimaya.

name: Kavu Predator
text:
Trample
Whenever an opponent gains life, put that many +1/+1 counters on Kavu Predator.

editions.flavor: In a withered world, the scent of healthy prey is enough to drive a predator to frenzy.
In a withered world, the scent of healthy prey is enough to drive a predator to frenzy.

name: Kavu Primarch
text:
Kicker {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell.)
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
If Kavu Primarch was kicked, it enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
